title: Causes of the American Revolution

vocab.definition: Being taxed by a government without having a voice in that government
Refusing to buy goods as a form of protest
A British law requiring colonists to pay taxes on printed materials
A protest where colonists dumped British tea into Boston Harbor
Harsh laws passed by Britain to punish Massachusetts

teachingNotes: Trace the escalating conflict between Britain and the colonies. Explain how economic and political grievances led to revolution.

sample.question: What meant being taxed without having a voice in government?

truefalse.question: The Boston Tea Party was a protest against British tea taxes.

multiplechoice.question: What was refusing to buy goods called?

fillintheblank.question: The ________ Act required colonists to pay taxes on printed materials.

shortanswer.question: Why did colonists oppose British taxation?
